intro: Endlicheria hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy endlicheria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a central cluster of stamens. Endlicheria hirsuta is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
